text: In summary , if in vitro antibiotic resistance patterns found in this study match in vivo resistance patterns , it can be concluded that the antibiotic resistance levels have possibly crossed the danger line for K . pneumoniae , Streptococcus species , E . agglomerans , and H . influenzae , although S . pneumoniae still exhibits sensitivity to a good number of antibiotics . It should be mentioned here that two isolates of S . pneumoniae from asymptomatic ARI participants showed an antibiotic sensitivity pattern similar to that of S . pneumoniae isolates from symptomatic children ( data not shown ) .
